name: 計算物理（二）
description: 在此課程中學生將學習如何利用程式語言及計算機(電腦)來處理常見的物理問題。
goals: 培養學生有分析及解決問題的能力
培養學生有表達觀念的能力
培養學生有程式寫作的能力
培養學生有數據分析的能力
syllabus:
**授課方式：16+2週. 彈性授課為第17週及第18週**, **進行方式為自主學習**

這是遠距課程, 詳細的進度及上課方式請見學校相關網站. 授課老師上課的電腦螢幕會錄影起來,放到 moodle 上以讓學生有機會複習.

There will be 16 weeks lectures and 2 weeks self-learning. Most of the lectures will be conducted remotely. The lecture will be recorded and uploaded to moodle. Depending on the progress, the feedback as well as the requests from the registered students, we may skip some topics listed below and introduce others.  

Week 1: Review of the use of python --> Review of numpy and pylab, Romberg method for integration, adaptive-size methods for integration, various quadrature methods for integration (scipy).. 

Week 2: Review of the use of python --> Continuation of numerical ODEs : Multi-steps method, backward method, and method of Numerov.                             

Week 3: Review of the use of python  --> Solving linear equations : Gauss elimination and LU decomposition.                                                                             

Week 4: Iteration methods for solving linear equations (CG, BiCGSTAB,and so on), the use scipy and numpy to solve linear equations.

Weeks 5,6,7 : Methods for solving boundary value problems including finite difference, fsolve of scipy, and shooting.

Week 8: Eigenvalues and Eigenvector.                                                                                                       

Week 9: Optmizations.                                                                                           

Week 10: Midterm exam.                                                                                                                                                                             

Week 11: Partial differential equations: Laplace and Poisson equations (Gauss-Seidel and ADI).

Weeks 12 and 13: Partial differential equations: Diffusion, Convection, and Burgers equations.

Weeks 14 and 15: Partial differential equations: Wave equations and Schrondinger equation.

Week 16: Random process and Monte Carlo

Final exam: Presentation.

Self-learning: More on Schrondinger equation and Monte Carlo

grading.note: There will be one in class exams. Students can use their own notes and codes for the exams, but  no internet is allowed when taking these exams.
There will be an oral presentation as the final exam.
